messages.message:
Hi team, we had a final feedback session with Thirdfort and here's the summary:
1. Thirdfort has a product that runs source of fund verification, proof of address, and other verifications for financial institutions. They are looking to automate these workflows using AI Hub for customers that don't want to use open banking to submit their data
2. Within 2 weeks, Thirdfort was able to create a solution in Build that extracts transaction table, currency, ending balance, and account number from bank statement. They were satisfied with the accuracy of the solution and would like to move forward with AI Hub
3. We were compared against Homeppl (https://www.homeppl.com/products/information/). Compared against them, we were much better at extracting information from scanned docs and photos, and they found our platform to be very easy to use ("too easy to use" at some points :sweat_smile:)
4. The biggest piece of feedback they had for improving our offering was around transaction table extraction. Knowing our expertise in solving for this challenge, they would have liked to see a template - not just a generic one for bank statements, but also one that contains how to extract transaction tables well accounting for most of the variability that exists across different banks' statements.
    a. On this note, I'm gonna have one more session with them to enable them on some of the best practices around working with bank statements. *If anyone has an example of a good transaction table field with robust cleaning functions that account for variability, please let me know.*

probably worth x-posting in <#C053455QN1M|> and <#CKBRX13L5|> to see if there are others with good examples of transaction table field extraction and to highlight the need for a better app template for bank statements

Hi @david.lee thanks for sharing the above feedback. You can definitely take a look at the existing Bank Statement marketplace app (https://aihub.instabase.com/hub/apps/75cbf90b-9edd-4253-a33d-81b4f2f0e88c) where the accuracy reported for the `Transaction Table` is ~75%. So far there is no UDF added for the clean up of data but if there is a need, please share the specifics and we can take a look.
@Anshu Thanks for that! Do you know where we got that ~75% accuracy data from?

This app was developed few months back when we used the IB platform (as AIHUB did not support the accuracy calculation feature back then) to compare the Goldens with the model output and calculated the accuracy. These (https://aihub.instabase.com/ib-internal/SolEng_workspace/fs/Instabase%20Drive/aihub/01910e2c-2fb5-7ba2-b59a-1f87a4e467a7/project/flows/goldens/) were the samples that we used for testing and linking the the wiki page (https://instabase.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/AE/pages/2413133826/Bank+Statement+Application) where you can find all the other necessary details.
